title: One US lawmaker killed, another hurt in 'politically motivated' shooting; gunman posed as cop
content: In a politically motivated attack, two Minnesota lawmakers were shot in their homes early Saturday. Former House Speaker Melissa Hortman was killed, while State Senator John Hoffman was wounded. Authorities are conducting a statewide manhunt for the suspect, who may have impersonated a police officer. The shootings have shocked the political community amid rising threats against elected officials.

title: 'Tehran no longer immune': Israel says it has air superiority over Iran, can strike freely
content: Israel claimed aerial freedom over Tehran after a large-scale strike involving over 70 fighter jets, targeting Iran's nuclear program and military sites. The operation, which lasted over two hours, aimed to dismantle Iran's military and nuclear capabilities, asserting that Tehran is now exposed to Israeli strikes. Israel stated the strikes will delay Iran's nuclear program by years.

title: 'Found calm in storm': SA end ICC trophy drought; what legends said after historic win
content: South Africa secured their first ICC trophy in 27 years, winning the World Test Championship at Lord's. Cricket legends like AB de Villiers and Sachin Tendulkar lauded the team's character and Temba Bavuma's leadership. Aiden Markram's century and his crucial partnership with Bavuma were pivotal in the victory against Australia.

title: Iran-Israel conflict: Can Netanyahu dethrone Ayatollah's regime?
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared strikes on Iran, targeting nuclear and military sites, aiming to disrupt Iran's nuclear program and potentially weaken the ruling regime. These actions, beyond nuclear facilities, targeted military commanders and nuclear experts, potentially destabilizing the Iranian government.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon to managers: 'Fire those who …'
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has advised managers to prioritize a positive workplace culture by firing employees and even customers who exhibit toxic behavior. Dimon emphasized that removing disruptive individuals, regardless of their contributions, is crucial for fostering a respectful and effective environment. He also mentioned his retirement is still several years away.

title: Great news! Waitlisted train passengers to know status 24 hours before departure
content: Indian Railways is piloting a new initiative to release train ticket confirmation status 24 hours before departure, replacing the current 4-hour window. This aims to reduce uncertainty for waitlisted passengers, allowing for better travel planning, especially for those traveling longer distances.

title: Layoffs at Google? Company tells employees to choose: 3 days to... or accept severance
content: Google is intensifying its return-to-office mandate, compelling remote employees within 50 miles of offices to adopt a three-day on-site work week or risk job termination. This policy expansion coincides with voluntary buyout programs for select US-based teams, excluding divisions like DeepMind and YouTube. Executives emphasize in-person collaboration as crucial for innovation and employee engagement.

title: ICC approves major changes: ODI ball rule revised, stricter concussion protocols
content: The ICC has revamped playing conditions for men's international cricket, effective mid-June and July. A key change in ODIs involves using two new balls only until the 34th over, aiming to balance bat and ball. Stricter concussion substitute rules now require teams to pre-name five role-specific replacements.

title: Fire for fire: 'Tehran will burn', warns Israel after missile barrage from Iran
content: Tensions escalate as Israel warns Iran that Tehran will "burn" if missile attacks on Jerusalem persist, following casualties and injuries. Iran retaliated with a barrage of missiles and drones, triggering sirens and explosions across Israeli cities. Netanyahu vowed to neutralize the Iranian threat, raising fears of a full-scale war despite international calls for restraint.

title: IND vs ENG: Old guard out, new 'leaders' in - Comparing India's 2021 & 2025 Test squads
content: India's 2025 Test squad in England signals a generational shift, contrasting sharply with the experienced 2021 team under an experienced Virat Kohli. Led by Shubman Gill, the new side lacks veteran presence due to retirements. While the bowling attack retains key figures like Bumrah and Jadeja, depth is a concern.

title: Microsoft's top executive to engineers: If you're working with AI-generated code...
content: Microsoft executives emphasize the enduring importance of coding skills in the age of AI. Aparna Chennapragada argues that logical and critical thinking, inherent in coding, are crucial for collaborating with AI systems. Satya Nadella highlights the need for computational thinking and structured instruction, envisioning a future where everyone is a software architect.

title: WTC Final: South Africa end 27-year ICC trophy drought; make history at Lord's
content: South Africa clinched a historic World Test Championship victory against Australia at Lord's, ending a 27-year ICC trophy drought. Chasing 282, the Proteas, led by Aiden Markram's unbeaten century and Temba Bavuma's resilient 87, secured a five-wicket win.

title: Returning to normalcy: J&K to reopen key tourist sites after Pahalgam attack
content: Following security assessments after the April 22 Pahalgam attack, Jammu and Kashmir lieutenant governor Manoj Sinha announced the phased reopening of parks and tourist destinations. Eight popular spots in the Kashmir Valley, including Beetab Valley, Verinag, and Badamwari Park, are among the first to welcome tourists again. A similar reopening process is underway in the Jammu region, with eight destinations set to reopen soon.

title: Memes break internet: Bavuma leads SA to their first ICC trophy in 27 years; beat AUS in WTC Final
content: Temba Bavuma captained South Africa to a historic ICC victory after 27 years. South Africa defeated Australia by five wickets at Lord's. Kagiso Rabada's nine wickets and Aiden Markram's century were crucial. Rabada surpassed Allan Donald as South Africa’s fourth-highest Test wicket-taker. The team celebrated the win as a culmination of years of frustration. Kyle Verreynne hit the winning shot.

title: 'Marriage ah?': Anirudh laughs off wedding buzz with Kavya; says 'chill out'
content: Amidst swirling rumours of a wedding with Sunrisers Hyderabad co-owner Kavya Maran, music composer Anirudh Ravichander has firmly denied the claims. Anirudh took to social media to dismiss the speculation, clarifying that the marriage reports are unfounded. While addressing the marriage rumours, he remained silent on the dating speculations that arose from alleged sightings with Kavya Maran.

title: 'Historic blunder': Himanta attacks Cong for letting Pak becoming nuclear state
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticized the Congress party for allegedly allowing Pakistan to become a nuclear power, claiming it now uses "nuclear blackmail." Sarma stated that India had the chance to eliminate Pakistan's nuclear threat in the 1980s, with support from the military and intelligence, but Indira Gandhi hesitated.

title: Watch: Maharaj in tears; SA beat Australia to end ICC trophy drought
content: South Africa clinched their first ICC trophy in 27 years, defeating Australia in a thrilling World Test Championship Final at Lord's. Aiden Markram's composed 136 anchored the chase, while Keshav Maharaj's emotional reaction highlighted the significance of the victory. The Proteas chased down 282, marking the second-highest successful chase at Lord's, sparking jubilant celebrations.

title: Publish Boeing report immediately: Whistleblower's lawyer to US FAA
content: Following the Air India crash involving a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner in Ahmedabad, attorneys for Boeing whistleblower Sam Salehpour are urging the FAA to release its findings on alleged structural defects in Boeing's 787 aircraft. Salehpour had previously raised concerns about the integrity of Boeing's 787 and 777 planes, prompting an FAA investigation.

title: Watch: Iran breaches Iron Dome, strikes Israel's 'Pentagon' in Tel Aviv
content: In a significant escalation of the ongoing conflict, Iran launched a retaliatory strike targeting Israel's Kirya compound in Tel Aviv, a critical military site housing the IDF's general staff and defence ministry. Reports indicate that a barrage of Iranian missiles struck deep into Israel's defence infrastructure, causing significant damage.

title: WTC Final: Australia lose first ICC final after 15 years; go down to South Africa
content: South Africa defeated Australia in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, ending Australia's decade-long unbeaten streak in ICC tournament finals. This defeat marks only Australia's fourth loss in 14 global finals over 50 years.

title: Onstage drama: Kamal Haasan loses cool after man gifts him a sword - video
content: Actor Kamal Haasan faced an awkward moment at a party meeting in Chennai. A man gifted him a sword on stage, leading to a brief commotion. Haasan appeared visibly displeased and asked the man to put the sword down. Meanwhile, Haasan is embroiled in a controversy in Karnataka. The Karnataka High Court addressed his remarks about the Kannada language. He claimed Kannada originated from Tamil, sparking outrage.

title: Why Sir David Beckham was an underrated footballer
content: ​For United fans of the current vintage, it’s hard to forget how good Beckham and his mates were and how terrifying it was for opposing teams when they played together. Because at that moment we were all in a Gurinder Chadha film, hoping to bend it like Beckham and if we couldn’t copy his mohawk hairstyle, much to the chagrin of mothers and teachers.

title: Air India crash: One more body recovered from AI-171 wreckage
content: The Air India AI-171 crash in Ahmedabad has claimed over 270 lives, marking India's worst aviation disaster. The Dreamliner, en route to London, crashed shortly after takeoff, hitting a medical college campus. Recovery efforts continue, with DNA matching underway to identify victims.

title: WTC Final: Hazlewood’s flawless finals streak ends; Australia fall to SA
content: Josh Hazlewood's unblemished record in major cricket finals came to an end as South Africa defeated Australia in the 2025 ICC World Test Championship final at Lord's. Despite Hazlewood's efforts with both ball and bat, including a crucial 59-run partnership, South Africa chased down the target, securing their first WTC title and ending Australia's reign.

title: Happy Father's Day 2025: Top 60 wishes, messages, images
content: Father's Day 2025 is approaching, offering a perfect opportunity to express love and gratitude to your dad. This collection of 50 heartfelt messages, greetings, and quotes will help you convey your appreciation. From funny anecdotes to inspirational words, find the perfect sentiment to make him feel cherished on his special day and beyond, reminding him of his invaluable role.

title: IND vs ENG: Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy launch postponed; out of respect for crash victims
content: The launch of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, intended to replace the Pataudi Trophy for India-England Test series in England, has been postponed. This decision follows the devastating plane crash in Ahmedabad, which claimed over 275 lives. The ECB and BCCI jointly decided to defer the ceremony out of respect for the victims.

title: ‘Standing silent as Israel annihilates a nation’: Congress on India's UN Gaza vote
content: The Congress party criticises the government's abstention from the UNGA vote on a Gaza ceasefire. Mallikarjun Kharge and other leaders call it a departure from India's foreign policy. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra deems the abstention shameful. Pawan Khera accuses the government of moral cowardice. K C Venugopal questions the shift in India's stance.

title: 'Not just a building': BJP protests attacks on Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh
content: The Bharatiya Janata Party's Sadar Urban Committee organized a protest rally in Agartala, condemning violence against minorities in Bangladesh and the reported attack on Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home. Senior BJP leaders addressed the crowd, criticizing the alleged atrocities and the silence of political opponents.

title: Air India plane crash: 'This one felt different', coffin maker after order for 100 units
content: Nilesh Vaghela, an Ahmedabad coffin maker, provided a crucial service following the devastating AI-171 crash that claimed 274 lives. Arriving at the civil hospital with 20 coffins, Nilesh, who typically makes seven coffins daily, received an urgent order for 100.

title: Israel attacks Gaza: 27 killed overnight - 16 in strikes, 11 in civilian shootings
content: Israeli airstrikes in Gaza resulted in the death of sixteen Palestinians. Eleven more Palestinians died near food distribution centers. Witnesses reported Israeli forces fired on civilians. The military claims it fired warning shots. Aid distribution faces challenges. The conflict began on October 7, 2023. It has caused numerous casualties. Recent Israeli strikes on Iran have escalated regional tensions.

title: Cabin crew deaths blur Kuki-Meitei divide; ‘angels of the sky unite 2 communities'
content: Manipur mourns the tragic loss of two cabin crew members, a Kuki and a Meitei, in the Ahmedabad Air India plane crash. This shared grief has momentarily united the communities, transcending ethnic divisions. Amidst the sorrow, there's an outpouring of support and calls for peace, highlighting the preciousness of human life and the need for coexistence.

title: Graduation celebration turns to grief: Daughter waits alone in UK as family never arrives
content: A family from Vasad, Anand, faced unimaginable tragedy as three members died in the Flight AI171 crash shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad. Rajnikant Patel, his wife Divya, and sister-in-law Hemangini were en route to London for Dhvani Patel's MBA graduation.

title: Cyprus, Canada and Croatia: PM Modi's first foreign visit since Op Sindoor
content: Narendra Modi will visit Cyprus, Canada, and Croatia. The Prime Minister will first visit Cyprus to meet President Nikos Christodoulides. He will then attend the G-7 Summit in Canada. Discussions will include energy security and AI. Finally, Modi will visit Croatia for talks with Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic and President Zoran Milanovic.

title: Air India crash: High-level panel to submit report in 3 months; AAIB decoding black box
content: Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu announced a three-month deadline for the Air India Flight 171 crash investigation in Ahmedabad. The recovery of the black box is expected to provide crucial insights into the cause of the accident. The flight, bound for London Gatwick, crashed shortly after takeoff, resulting in numerous fatalities, with only one survivor.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Air India, AI Express drop flight number '171' – report
content: Following the tragic crash of Air India flight 'AI 171' from Ahmedabad to London Gatwick, which claimed 241 lives, both Air India and Air India Express have decided to discontinue using the flight number. The Ahmedabad-London Gatwick service will now operate under 'AI 159'.

title: 'Striking dozens of Iran missile launchers,' says Israel; two Iranian generals killed
content: Tensions soar as Israel targets Iranian missile sites after Tehran's retaliatory strikes. Two Iranian generals are dead. Israel hit targets near Tehran. Rockets struck residential areas in Israel, causing casualties. The conflict escalates with strikes deep inside Iran. Iran retaliated with missile barrages at Tel Aviv and Jerusalem. International calls for calm are growing louder.

title: Iran appoints Amir Hatami as army chief after Israel kills top generals
content: Following Israeli strikes that killed top commanders, Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei appointed Amir Hatami as the new Army Chief. This reshuffle includes naming Mohammad Pakpour as IRGC Commander and Ali Shadmani as Commander of the Khatam al-Anbiya Central Headquarters. These changes come after Operation Rising Lion, which significantly impacted Iran's military leadership, prompting retaliatory strikes and heightened regional tensions.

title: Temperatures fall in Delhi but why does it still feel like 50.3°C?
content: Delhi experienced a drop in maximum temperature by up to 6.1 degrees Celsius on Friday, offering slight respite from the intense heat, though high humidity persisted. A change in weather patterns, including a trough line and a western disturbance, brought moisture and thunder activity to northwest India.

title: Who is the favorite? Is Scheffler still in contention? Sizing up the weekend at the U.S. Open
content: Oakmont has lived up to expectations though two days. We break down the second round and what to look for in the final two rounds.

title: SGA's 4th-quarter flurry saves OKC, evens Finals
content: Led by Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's 15-point fourth quarter, the Thunder rallied from a 10-point second-half deficit to win 111-104 and tie the NBA Finals at 2-2.

title: Burns, one of 3 players under par, atop U.S. Open
content: Sam Burns avoided a meltdown that ruined his opening round at the U.S. Open and wound up with a big par save on his last hole for a 5-under 65 and the 36-hole lead.

title: DeChambeau, Mickelson slip late, head home early
content: Oakmont got the best of many of the world's best players this week, with Bryson DeChambeau, Phil Mickelson and Dustin Johnson among the notables to miss the cut.

title: Sources: Knicks set for talks with Brown, Jenkins
content: The Knicks are set to begin the first stage of formal interviews for their head coaching job next week, with plans to meet with Mike Brown and Taylor Jenkins, sources told ESPN.

title: Crochet after win: No regrets on HR pitch to Judge
content: Garrett Crochet held New York scoreless over a career-high 8 1/3 innings, but Aaron Judge's solo home run in the ninth ruined his shutout and his chance at the win.

title: Howard (9 3s) ties record; Griner now 2nd in blocks
content: Rhyne Howard made a career-high nine 3-pointers -- tying the WNBA single-game record -- and finished with a season-high 36 points in the Dream's win over the Sky. Also, Brittney Griner moved into second place on the WNBA career blocks list.

title: Reds' Miley denies wrongdoing in Skaggs case
content: Reds left-hander Wade Miley says he has not been accused of any wrongdoing, after reports stated a deposition from a lawsuit alleged that he supplied Tyler Skaggs with drugs when both players were with the Diamondbacks.

title: Coastal Carolina, Oregon St. win to open MCWS
content: Coastal Carolina broke open a tie game with three runs in the eighth inning as the Chanticleers opened the Men's College World Series with a 7-4 victory. Oregon State then bested Louisville 4-3 on a walk-off hit.

title: 🤝 The most powerful friendship in basketball
content: From group chats to high-level X's and O's breakdowns, the two superstars have pushed themselves -- and each other -- to the top of the basketball universe.

title: Panthers-Oilers Game 5 preview: Who will win pivotal showdown?
content: It's now a best-of-three for the ultimate prize. Here are key stats, players and matchups, plus betting intel.

title: The NBA draft's best at 20 different traits, skills: Where Flagg, Bailey and Fears stand out
content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: 'The secret sauce': Inside the closets of superstars SGA and Tyrese Haliburton
content: From clutch performances to fashion icons, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's and Tyrese Haliburton's closets contain the magic.

title: How George Duangmanee's second round showed the beauty and the harshness of the U.S. Open
content: Duangmanee didn't have the results any golfer would hope for. But he was still playing in the U.S. Open and was going to take the positive out of that.

title: Usman is back with a plan to take on the new generation
content: The former welterweight champion returns to the Octagon against Joaquin Buckley at UFC Fight Night in Atlanta.

title: NFL minicamp updates: Cameron Ward throws some picks, Travis Hunter gets reps at CB and WR
content: The majority of NFL mandatory minicamps are in action this week. Our reporters have the latest from around the league.

title: NFL scouts pick 10 early sleepers for the 2026 draft: Which prospects could rise quickly?
content: We asked NFL evaluators to pick out prospects in next year's draft class who aren't being talked about enough right now. Here are 10 names to know.

title: Is MLS going to get embarrassed at the Club World Cup?
content: The Vancouver Whitecaps lost 5-0 in the Concacaf Champions Cup final. What will happen when MLS sides face even sterner tests in the Club World Cup?

title: Mega-preview: Predictions, what you need to know about all 32 teams
content: Saturday sees the start of the tournament, with 32 teams playing 63 games between June 14 and July 13.

title: Sources: Pogba in talks to return with Monaco
content: Paul Pogba is close to ending his two-year absence from football after opening with AS Monaco over a deal with the Ligue 1 team, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mexico prez calls for no ICE action at Gold Cup
content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum urged U.S. authorities not to conduct immigration enforcement targeting attendees of a Gold Cup match in the Los Angeles area.

title: Arise, Sir David: Beckham knighted by king
content: Manchester United and England legend David Beckham has been awarded a knighthood in King Charles' Birthday Honours list.

title: Sources: Liverpool agrees to $157M Wirtz deal
content: Liverpool have agreed to sign Bayer Leverkusen's Florian Wirtz in a deal that could rise to a British transfer record fee of £116m, sources have told ESPN.

title: Boca's Costa gets U.S. visa for CWC after U-turn
content: Boca Juniors defender Ayrton Costa will be able to take part in the Club World Cup in the United States following a u-turn by U.S. immigration officials who had previously rejected his visa application, the Argentine club said on Friday.

title: Messi on CWC: Expectations different with Miami
content: Lionel Messi shared that he has different expectations with Inter Miami going into the 2025 Club World Cup than when competing previously with other teams.

title: Source: Barça set to sign keeper García for €25m
content: Barcelona are set to sign Joan García after exercising the Espanyol goalkeeper's €25 million ($28.9 million) release clause, a source has confirmed to ESPN.

title: Dodgers desperately need Shohei Ohtani's arm, but his bat will do -- for now
content: The state of L.A.'s injury-riddled pitching staff is alarming. But Ohtani is too valuable to rush back to the mound.

title: Why Caitlin Clark offers the best betting value for MVP
content: With Caitlin Clark set to return to the court on Saturday, there's no better time to bet on her to win WNBA MVP than right now.

title: Overheard at the NBA Finals: Latest buzz on the futures of KD, Giannis and the Knicks
content: What are NBA insiders saying about the biggest offseason storylines? Tim Bontemps and Brian Windhorst canvass the league.

title: Fouls, aggression and long shots galore: What it really means to 'get Concacafed'
content: This summer's Concacaf Gold Cup is sure to provide a lot of shenanigans, and not just for the USMNT. But what exactly makes North and Central American soccer so brutal and silly?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal's Gyökeres interest could push United to Osimhen
content: Manchester United will turn to Victor Osimhen if they lose out on Viktor Gyökeres to Arsenal. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: Bueckers, Loyd heading in different directions
content: Paige Bueckers' fantasy potential takes center stage this week while Jewell Lloyd hasn't quite lived up to expectations early in the season.

title: Verstappen vows to 'race like I always do'
content: Max Verstappen vowed to "race like I always do" despite finding himself on the verge of a one-race ban.

title: LDF does not need communal votes: Pinarayi
content: Chief Minister lashes out at Centre, Opposition and P.V. Anwar during byelection campaign in Nilambur

title: Monsoon lags in south-interior Karnataka, but early rains have ensured healthy reservoir levels
content: The initial spell of rains in the catchment area of the Cauvery in Kodagu, ensured a continuous inflow into the KRS which breached the 100-ft mark as early as on May 30

title: Neo-fascist regimes divert attention from crisis by targeting minorities: Prabhat Patnaik
content: Patnaik calls for progressive reforms like wealth taxes on ultra-rich and inheritance taxes on passed-down assets, stressing that only a radical rethinking of economic order can curb  rising tide of authoritarianism

title: Proposed AC temperature-control norms build on 2018 guidelines
content: In 2020, the government had mandated that all air conditioners have a default setting of 24 degrees Celsius, which is considered an optimal setting for human comfort

title: Four Maoists, including three women, killed in ongoing encounter in M.P’s Balaghat
content: Combing efforts are going on in multiple areas and the encounter will continue at least till June 15, says a top police officer

title: MLC Puttanna threatens protest over school toilet cleaning issue
content: The MLC claims there are no attenders or cleaning staff in government schools, and a situation has arisen where teachers are sometimes compelled to clean toilets

title: 11 Air India crash victims identified through DNA; families begin collecting remains
content: Describing DNA matching as a “meticulously slow process,” Dr. Rajnish Patel, Head of Surgery, Ahmedabad Civil Hospital, added, “We need to carry it out with utmost care and precision.”

title: Telangana objects to Centre asking A.P. to submit DPR of Banakacherla project by month-end
content: Minister for Irrigation N. Uttam Kumar Reddy terms the project a violation of the provisions of APRA and GWDT, urges Centre to reject PFR/DPR

title: KC(M) steps up outreach ahead of local body polls
content: Party is ramping up its outreach efforts in central Travancore by hosting a series of seminars and symposiums to highlight pressing social issues of the region

title: Rubber Board to fill vacant posts amid staff shortage; farmers cautiously optimistic
content: Union Ministry of Commerce and Industry grants approval for the appointment of 97 new staff members, including 46 field officers and 29 scientists across three categories

title: Inter-State gang of burglars held in Madanapalle, valuables worth ₹20 lakh recovered
content: The six-member gang has been involved in burglaries that targeted locked houses and residences at isolated stretches along the highways in Madanapalle and Kurabalakota mandals

title: Death of tribal woman in Idukki found to be  case of murder
content: Iitial inference was that Seetha, 42, a resident of Thottappura under the Murinjapuzha forest station, was killed in a wild elephant attack at the Meenmutty reserve forest area on Friday

title: Living donor transplants thrive as Kerala turns its face away from deceased donor organ donations
content: Of all the organ donations that had taken place in the State in the last five years, less than 10% constituted deceased donor organ donation. Resolving all systemic issues and taking government doctors into confidence can help save more lives, say experts.

title: West Godavari District Collector orders probe against 17 private hospitals for collecting extra fees under NTR Vaidya Seva Trust
content: A fine will imposed against the hospitals and further action will be initiated in the case of treating the patients by registering fake disease profile, she says

title: Ayyampuzha panchayat to appoint shooter to cull wild boars
content: The panchayat sourced a list of licensed shooters from the Aluva tahsildar, which will soon be placed before the committee for final selection

title: 47 Tamil medium students now will be part of midday meal scheme in Idukki
content: They are the students of Udumbanchola Government High School. The upper primary section functioning in the school did not have a government approval, so the students were ineligible for the scheme

title: J&K L-G reopens 16 tourist destinations closed after Pahalgam attack
content: Eight spots each from Jammu and Kashmir regions reopened; L-G Sinha announces phased re-opening of remaining destinations

title: Karnataka High Court directs State Home Secretary to mandate all educational institutions, health establishments, business entities to report engagement with foreign nationals to FRRO
content: All existing foreign nationals currently associated with these institutions/establishments must be audited and verified, the court says

title: Tiruchi Corporation faces challenges in impounding cattle roaming the roads as owners remain defiant
content: A total of 145 head of cattle were rounded up between May and June 14 and of these, 88 were impounded during a mass night drive carried out in the last two weeks

title: Congress has become 'fake news factory', alleges BJP
content: India was among the 19 nations that abstained, while 12 countries voted against the UN General Assembly resolution, which got 149 votes in favour

title: JD(S) to launch campaign to strengthen party in Karnataka
content: While the programme will be formally launched by Union Minister for Heavy Industries and Steel H.D. Kumaraswamy on Sunday, it will get going from Gubbi in Tumakuru district from Monday

title: Researchers from Calicut varsity develop cost-effective nanoclusters
content: These tiny materials, invisible to the naked eye, display exceptional photophysical properties, which make them ideal for future applications in sustainable lighting, display technologies, and biomedical imaging

title: Arunachal announces decade-long focus on hydropower projects
content: The Cabinet nod for creating authorities to build ‘future-ready alternate towns’ and a necklace road above ‘likely submergence areas’ indicated a thrust for the controversial Siang Upper Multipurpose Project

title: Heavy rainfall alert in six Telangana districts on June 15
content: Heavy rain is very likely to occur at isolated places in Rangareddy, Mahabubnagar, Nagarkurnool, Wanaparthy, Narayanpet, and Jogulamba Gadwal districts

title: Shakti app to offer immediate police assistance during emergencies: Sri Sathya Sai SP
content: SP and Deputy SP reach out to women and adolescent girls in various educational institutions in the district and demonstrate the usage and benefits of the app

title: Awards for K.V. Mohan Kumar, Tharun Moorthy
content: The awards comprise mementoes designed by artist Sreejesh Gopal, a citation, and a cash prize of ₹10,000

title: A ‘millety’ nutribar from CSIR-National Institute for Interdisciplinary Science and Technology
content: This millet-based nutrition bar delivers 228.66 kcal of energy per serving and is rich in natural protein content

title: Ahmedabad flight crash: A surprise that ended in tragedy
content: “I didn’t know they were coming. When they showed up at my door, I was speechless. I hadn’t seen them since 2022”, says Anil Ambalal Patel who lost his son and daughter-in-law in the devastating Air India plane crash

title: Hyderabad marks World Blood Donor Day with awareness drives, donations camps
content: At Nizam’s Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS), the day began with an awareness rally led by Sudhir Kumar, head of the Blood Donation Centre

title: NDA government in Andhra Pradesh has fulfilled 85% of its election promises, says I&PR Minister Parthasarathy
content: Due priority has been accorded to Talliki Vandanam scheme under which financial assistance is being given to the mothers, irrespective of the number of children, he asserts

title: The anatomy of a stampede in Bengaluru
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru’s IPL victory celebration in Bengaluru turned tragic with a stampede, leaving 11 dead and 56 injured. The Hindu recounts the sequence of events to analyse how multiple things went wrong in 24 hours

title: Agricultural households in Kerala increasingly viewing social media as source for farming-related technical advisory services: report
content: Social media was followed by radio, television, and other electronic media, print media, and smartphone-based apps

title: Alappuzha district panchayat begins distribution of Manuratna paddy seeds under Vithu Gramam project
content: In the initial phase, 4,500 kg of seeds have been distributed to two paddy polders in Punnapra North grama panchayat. Farmers in Nooranad grama panchayat cultivated the Manuratna variety.

title: Practising yoga is important for physical and mental health, says official
content: He urges people to incorporate yoga into their daily lives as it is essential for developing a healthy society

title: Indian diplomacy didn’t fail, countries work according to their own interests: Shiv Shankar Menon
content: In a preliminary analysis of Operation Sindoor, the former National Security Advisor says the military did well, but lessons need to be learnt on strategic communication

title: 'We did not ...': India distances itself from SCO statement on Iran-Israel conflict

title: Plane crash: Air India announces Rs 25 lakh interim relief each to kin of victims
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: "Brilliant, Disciplined": Professor Remembers Co-Pilot Of Plane That Crashed
content: "Very difficult for me to digest the news," a professor of Clive Kunder, the co-pilot of the ill-fated Air India Ahmedabad-London flight, broke down as she remembered her "brilliant and disciplined" student.

title: Israel Attacks Iran News LIVE: US Still Wants Talks With Iran After Tehran Rejection: US Official
content: Israel Attacks Iran Live Updates: A new explosion was heard at a key uranium enrichment site in central Iran on Friday morning, hours after Israel launched unprecedented air strikes against the Islamic Republic's nuclear programme.

title: As Trump Turns 79, Washington To Host Military Parade Amid National Protests
content: While the capital prepares for military fanfare, demonstrations opposing the Trump administration are set to erupt in over 1,500 locations nationwide.

title: 'NRI City' Couple Cancelled June 6 Plan, Booked Doomed June 12 London Flight
content: Located approximately 76 km from Ahmedabad, Anand is known as Gujarat's 'NRI City'. Of the 274 people who died in the Ahmedabad plane crash on Thursday, 33 from Anand were on board the doomed Flight AI171 en route to London Gatwick.

title: 328 Arms, 9,300 Rounds Of Ammunition Recovered In Manipur By Joint Forces
content: In a major development, the security forces in joint operations, have recovered 328 arms and around 9,300 different types of ammunition in restive Manipur.

title: UP Woman Thrashed By Husband And In-Laws, Hot Iron Pressed On Genitals, Dies
content: A woman, married for 10 years and a mother of two young children, has died after allegedly being brutally thrashed and tortured by pressing a hot iron all over her body, including her genitals, in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh.

title: 'What I Saw Scared Me': Teen Whose Ahmedabad Plane Crash Video Went Viral
content: A 17-year-old boy in Ahmedabad, who unwittingly captured a viral video of Thursday's devastating Air India AI 171 plane crash, has given his statement to the police, officials said on Saturday.

title: Air India To Provide Rs 25 Lakh Interim Payment To Crash Victims' Famillies
content: Air India on Saturday announced that it will provide an interim payment of Rs 25 lakh to the families of the deceased and survivors of the Ahmedabad plane crash.

title: Russia And Ukraine Exchange Prisoners, But Moscow Says No War Dead Received
content: The exchanges are part of agreements reached by the warring sides during talks in Istanbul earlier this month. Ukraine earlier on Saturday confirmed it had received the bodies of its soldiers killed in action.

title: How Protests, Middle East, Bad Weather Can Rain On Trump's Military Parade
content: The celebrations will cost the U.S. Army between $25 million and $45 million, U.S. officials have told Reuters. That includes the parade itself as well as the cost of moving equipment and housing and feeding the troops.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Falcon Rocket's Close Call: How ISRO Helped Prevent A Space Disaster
content: The timely detection of a "crack in an oxidizer line" in the first stage of the Falcon-9 rocket - which will take four astronauts, including India's Shubhanshu Shukla, to the International Space Station - averted a major disaster.

title: Destinations Closed After Pahalgam Attack Being Reopened In Phased Manner
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha said the parks at tourist places, which were closed in view of security considerations after the April 22 Pahalgam attack, are being reopened in a phased manner.

title: FIR Against Supertech, Its Promoter For Defrauding IDBI Bank Of Rs 126.07 Crore
content: The CBI has registered an FIR against Noida-based construction firm Supertech Limited and its promoter R K Arora among others for allegedly defrauding IDBI Bank of Rs 126.07 crore.

title: Indian Embassy In Tel Aviv Establishes 24x7 Helpline Amid Israel-Iran Conflict
content: The Indian Embassy in Tel Aviv on Saturday set up a round the clock emergency helpline and advised Indian nationals to stay vigilant after escalation in Israel's conflict with Iran.

title: Engines Lost Power At Critical Stage: Ex-Air Force Chief On Air India Plane Crash
content: Former Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal Arup Raha (Reired), on Saturday said the engine of the Air India aircraft that crashed near Ahmedabad airport on June 12 "definitely" lost power at a critical stage and there was no time for recovery.

title: DNA Of 9 Plane Crash Victims Matched, 1st Body Handed Over To Family Members
content: With DNA profiling of nine victims of Thursday's Air India crash complete, the hospital authorities handed over the first body to a family in Ahmedabad Saturday.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash Live: DNA Samples Of 9 Victims Matched, Toll Reaches 274
content: Ahmedabad Air India Plane Crash Live Updates: At least 274 people were killed in one of India's deadliest plane crashes involving a London-bound Air India flight in Ahmedabad earlier this week.

title: Mass Coffin-Making Underway In Ahmedabad After Plane Crash Death Count Rises
content: In the aftermath of Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad that claimed 241 lives, the somber task of preparing coffins is now underway.

title: "No Space For Bezos": Why Venice Locals Are Against The Billionaire's Wedding
content: Activists have ramped up their "No space for Bezos" campaign after Luigi Brugnaro, Venice's millionaire mayor, confirmed in March that the couple would be getting married in the city.
